content.body: TabAtkins: consider https://gist.github.com/domenic/1f286d415559b56d725bee51a62c24a7 for redirecting the docs

How would one go about acquiring implementer interest? And what exactly does implementer interest refer to? I assume "implementer" refers to browser vendors, or does it also refer to web developers who wish to use a proposed API?
content.formatted_body: How would one go about acquiring implementer interest? And what exactly does implementer interest refer to? I assume "implementer" refers to browser vendors, or does it also refer to web developers who wish to use a proposed API?

content.body: Implementers refers to browser vendors, since they're the ones who will have to implement the API
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Implementers refers to browser vendors, since they're the ones who will have to implement the API

content.body: Polyfills don't really count for that definition
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Polyfills don't really count for that definition

content.body: nor do non-browser runtimes like Node.js, Deno, Cloudflare Workers...
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: nor do non-browser runtimes like Node.js, Deno, Cloudflare Workers...

content.body: Although I guess it would be more accurate to speak of browser _engine_ vendors, rather than browser vendors, since Edge isn't considered an implementer separate from Chrome
content.formatted_body: Although I guess it would be more accurate to speak of browser engine vendors, rather than browser vendors, since Edge isn't considered an implementer separate from Chrome

content.body:
> <@abotella:igalia.com> Although I guess it would be more accurate to speak of browser _engine_ vendors, rather than browser vendors, since Edge isn't considered an implementer separate from Chrome

I'm kind of confused why MDN even lists Microsoft Chrome and Chinese Chrome as separate browsers, they all have the same features.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @abotella:igalia.com
Although I guess it would be more accurate to speak of browser engine vendors, rather than browser vendors, since Edge isn't considered an implementer separate from Chrome
I'm kind of confused why MDN even lists Microsoft Chrome and Chinese Chrome as separate browsers, they all have the same features.
